newsitem.title: INDIA: India PSUs allowed to invest in UTI mutual funds.
newsitem.headline: India PSUs allowed to invest in UTI mutual funds.

text.p: The Indian cabinet has allowed public sector units to invest surplus funds in Unit Trust of India's (UTI) mutual funds, United News of India (UNI) said on Friday.
"This is intended to inject liquidity in the stock market as the UTI is the largest domestic institutional player in the market," UNI said.
The news agency said the government had barred public sector units from placing short-term surplus funds with banks following a stock market scandal in 1992.
Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda's cabinet met on Thursday evening.
